descriptionText: AWS Security Group should not have an unknown port exposed to the entire Internet
detailedDescriptionText:
Security groups should not allow traffic on non-standard or uncommon ports from the public internet (0.0.0.0/0 or ::/0).

Exposing uncommon or unknown ports to the internet creates unnecessary attack vectors, as these ports may run services with unpatched vulnerabilities, weak configurations, or development/debugging interfaces that were never intended for public access.

Restrict security group rules to allow access only to well-known, required ports (such as 80/443 for web services) from public networks. For non-standard or internal services, limit access to specific IP ranges or VPCs. Regularly audit security groups to identify and remove rules allowing traffic to unusual ports from public networks.
